data.title: Good Mexican Food at reasonable price
data.text: I have been here with American Friends. They serve typical Mexican food. Good quality, a lot of options,  nothing very special or unusual. You get good food at reasonable price, so if you love Tacos, Fajitas and all that stuff it is worth visiting.

data.title: Yummy!
data.text: Ate here with friends.  Our Sons tried the Mt. Nachismo, and enjoyed it but didn't finish it.  The place had good food and a nice atmosphere.  I enjoyed the visit.

data.title: Mexican Food in Ann Arbor
data.text: We ordered a variety of Mexican food and do not regret going like that- it was delicious! Also, the Mexican beer and tequila were excellent, too!

data.title: Great lunch place!
data.text: The food was good. The service was excellent! The prices were on point for AnnArbor. The jalapeño salsa was great! We will go back.

data.title: Authentic Mexican food
data.text:
I enjoyed a great authentic  Mexican meal at Tios last evening.
The staff was friendly and attentive.

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: The wife and I love to visit this place everytime we go to Ann Arbor for a trip. The drinks are fantastic as are the bartenders. Have not really had much to eat, but the chips and dips are great! Always busy, we generally sit at the bar and drink. Good selection of drinks and tequila. Not a big place, but fun!

data.title: OK Pricey Mexican Food
data.text: My daughter loves this place, so I'm there every once in a while. Tios used to be a hole in the wall place on Huron, but they went a bit upscale when they moved to their Liberty location. The food is OK, but nothing to write home about. It's above fast food but basically is still Americanize Mexican. Other Mexican places in the area have better food at much lower prices (Los Amigos, Don Juan's). I have not tried the drinks at the bar, although I have heard people say it is pretty good and it looks like they have a good selection of tequila. I guess I am just tired of being surprised at the bill when it comes for rather unmemorable food.

data.title: Not sure what all the excitement is about
data.text:
Had a date for lunch, we were in the mood for Mexican and wondered why we have never gone to Tios. Seems like our friends all have been and nobody had anything bad to say. 

The restaurant had about four tables filled at 1pm on a Wednesday. Minor red flag being in a great downtown location. I ordered three tacos to see how they'd do it - Steak, Shrimp and fish. My date had the enchiladas. None of the entrees we had are good enough to rave about. Even with the steak at medium rare it was still pretty tough, and the fish taco looked like it was a cut up, breaded frozen fish filet. (At least it was not a fish stick like their competitor down the street - is that who they're measuring up to?) My date's rice and bean accompaniments had zero taste to it, if you were blindfolded it could have been mistaken for baby food. 

Our waitress just left a pitcher of water for us to service ourselves, even though by the end of our meal no ice could be found in the pitcher. In this meal, I'd have to side with those that complain 15% is too much tip for someone who takes your order, have the expediter deliver your entrees and pick up your bill. 

Not sure what the good reviewers experienced.

data.title: Awesome Fish Tacos!
data.text: Met a friend of mine here for dinner one night and we both enjoyed their fish tacos. Service was good and we also had some margaritas. Their chips and salsa is also delicious and appreciated. Overall, a very delicious meal. I will definitely be back again.

data.title: Great combos and friendly service from Brandon
data.text:
I came here for a quick bite at the bar, and got an amazing combo that came with an empaña, stuffed rilano pepper (the best part of the dish!) and vegetables. Would definitely recommend that one.
Brandon at the bar gave friendly service despite me being sleepy!

data.title: Excellent Lunch!
data.text: This was my first time at this restaurant. We were there for lunch. The food was excellent! Genuine, non-greasy, delicious food! Everything tasted fresh and light. Everyone was happy with our meal!

data.title: Friendly service, fab food!
data.text:
I always think it's best to leave it a couple of days before reviewing any Mexican restaurant....... so here goes!
The service in Tios was both friendly and efficient. The extensive menu made choosing a problem but fortunately they had a number of combo choices for those in my position.
I opted for the excellently priced classic combo and the massive portion of freshly prepared tasty food was washed down by a nice chilled beer.

data.title: amazing food!
data.text: Best fish tacos around and the queso there is the die for! Amazing food and service. Great place to eat.

data.title: "A La Carte"
data.text: Pretty decor. Friendly waitstaff. (but) Most restaurants serve beans & rice with their main dishes. Are We cutting waste here, idk.

data.title: Tios
data.text: I love sitting outside on the patio with a margarita and the food is delicious!! I love their enchiladas and the salsa has so much flavor!

data.title: Food was OK, service could have been much better
data.text: Our party of five sat on the so-called "Sangria Patio" which is simply a terrace with a sidewalk view.  We were off to a poor start with an impatient and not very friendly waitperson.  However, the food was pretty good.  I had the Fajita Salad in which I substituted mushrooms for the chicken to have a vegetarian entree.  The mushrooms were plentiful and flavorful.  The other diners enjoyed their meals but we all agreed that the food is good but definitely not great.

data.title: Food above average, restaurant management awol
data.text:
My daughter, husband and their kids wanted to go here based on the an episode of Man against Food.  My son and grands on had combo plates which were large and plentiful. My wife had the spanish meatballs which were spice but good. My daughter had three of the soft tacos.I had the chicken soft taco's and found the filling to be gritty-but not wanting to stir up the daily did not send them back. 
My daughter had an enjoyable margarita.

The rub came at check out time.  Our waitress show as delightful got bogged down st an adjacent table making something table side, then the customers wanted an encyclopedic description of each of the dishes.  I waited 15 minutes for our money to be taken, nary a restaurant manager paying attention to what was going on on the floor.  This is not customer friendly.

data.title: Decent Mexican food
data.text: The wait staff was very friendly and attentive. The food was good but nothing stood out. The rest of our table seemed to enjoy their entrees. Nice selection of salsas, varying in heat level.

data.title: The best Tequila.
data.text: A great place to hang and drink Tequila. We had a great time stopping in and chatting with the bartenders and having great food and drinks. We loved it. Not a big place, but great atmosphere. Will be back next visit to Ann Arbor.

data.title: Tios went above and beyond!
data.text:
We popped into Tios after walking around campus. We put in our order and hung out chatting and laughing. Unfortunately our order got lost somewhere and suddenly we realized that we'd been waiting almost an hour for our food. But the staff were all so apologetic and sincere about it that we weren't even mad! 

Once they realized the mistake, our food came out super quick and it was DELICIOUS!! We really felt taken care of and we totally understand that sometimes things like that happen. It was how well they treated us and how well they took care of the situation that will ensure we definitely come back the next time we are in town. Thanks so much!!
